title: Authors and Citation
text: Johnson M (2022). : Read Write Metadata. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {about: Read and Write Metadata},   author = {Matt Johnson},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Read and Write Metadata
text: purpose read write metadata. Specifically can read metadata webpage can write arbitrary metadata YAML header Rmarkdown Quarto file.

title: Read and Write Metadata
code: library(about)  read_metadata('https://www.w3.org/', output = 'data.frame') #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   property    content                                                            #>   <chr>       <chr>                                                              #> 1 viewport    width=device-width                                                 #> 2 description The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) is an international community… #> 3 og:title    World Wide Web Consortium (W3C)

what: Adding Metadata to the YAML Header
title: Read and Write Metadata
text: code create new Quarto file following yaml header:
code: create_document(   title = 'My New Quarto with Metadata',    .fun = 'quarto',    security = 'confidential',    categories = c('metadata','create') ) --- title: My New Quarto with Metadata format: html editor: visual uuid: a5b32d65-cf7a-4d1b-a996-5d22f4d65359 draft: yes security: confidential categories:   - metadata   - create ---

Read Website Metadata — read_metadata
text: url charcter url website, path html document output character defining desired output type. Must one : (list) data.frame force logical force metadata retrieval site authorise scraping. option used owner site.

title: Read Website Metadata — read_metadata
code: read_metadata('https://www.w3.org/') #> $viewport #> [1] "width=device-width" #>  #> $description #> [1] "The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) is an international community where Member organizations, a full-time staff, and the public work together to develop Web standards." #>  #> $`og:title` #> [1] "World Wide Web Consortium (W3C)" #>
